Package appointment

Class AppointmentController

  • java.lang.Object
    • appointment.AppointmentController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class AppointmentController
extends Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    This class is the controller for AppointmentView.
    Version:
    1.0, 01/22/21
    Author:
    Eric Westfall

      • AppointmentController

        public AppointmentController()

    • Method Detail

      • handleAdd

        private void handleAdd()
        Handles what happens when the user clicks Add in AppointmentView. Loads the appointment edit view with no data.

      • handleEdit

        private void handleEdit()
        Handles what happens when the user clicks Edit in AppointmentView. Passes the appointment's id to the appointment DAO and then loads the appointment edit view with the selected appointment's data.

      • handleDelete

        private void handleDelete()
        Handles what happens when the user clicks Delete in AppointmentView. Deletes the selected appointment.

      • handleCancel

        private void handleCancel​(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        Handles what happens when the user clicks Cancel in AppointmentView. Takes the user back to the main menu.

      • apptChoiceBoxHandle

        private void apptChoiceBoxHandle()
        Refreshes the appointments table when the user chooses a new time frame in the choice box.

      • bindTableView

        private void bindTableView()
        Binds the tableview to Appointments from the AppointmentDAO.

      • bindColumns

        private void bindColumns()
        Binds the table view's columns to their matching data.

        This method is a series of lambdas that populate the various columns. Lambdas are easy to use here and make the code easy to read because the setCellValueFactory() methods are factories that take an iterated series of constructor methods as input. The alternative would be a series of for loops, which are much more tedious and less readable.

      • displayAppointments

        private void displayAppointments()
        Displays the appointments in the table view. Retrieves appointments from the appointment DAO using the time mode selected and then displays them in the appointment table view.

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(URL url,
                       ResourceBundle rb)
        Initializes the appointment view.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url - Unused.
        rb - Unused.

      • getDao

        public AppointmentDAOImp getDao()
        Returns the appointment DAO.
        Returns:
        The AppointmentDAOImp returned.
